results.firPara: Perhaps this game did not live up to its billing, perhaps it never could, but the result was huge. Far from invincible any longer, much less invulnerable against Italy, Spain are on their way home. Whether that counts as a shock depends on how stern a view one takes of their fall from grace in Brazil two years ago, though what is indisputable is that Italy were superior in almost every department with the possible exception of finishing.
results.secPara: If Antonio Conte had a predator at his disposal in the great Italian tradition the scoreline might have been even more emphatic. As it was Italy were hanging on before Graziano Pellès breakaway clincher in stoppage time set up a quarter-final against Germany in Bordeaux on Saturday, a position they should never have been in after controlling the game.
results.webTitle: Italy’s Giorgio Chiellini and Graziano Pellè end Spain’s European reign

results.firPara: Wales expect Ashley Williams to be fit for their quarter-final against Belgium on Friday despite the captains sustaining a shoulder injury in the closing stages of the victory against Northern Ireland.
results.secPara: Wales finished behind Belgium as runners-up in qualifying for Euro 2016 but Chris Colemans side have not lost against their upcoming opponents – ranked No2 in the world by Fifa – in three attempts.
results.webTitle: Wales wait for Ashley Williams to lead resistance against Belgium

results.firPara: Juventus have confirmed the signing of Dani Alves on a two-year contract, with the defender given the option to extend the deal by another 12 months.
results.secPara: The Brazilian, who departed Barcelona at the end of last season after eight years at Camp Nou, underwent a medical on Monday morning in Turin and was greeted by hundreds of Bianconeri supporters upon arrival.
results.webTitle: Juventus confirm signing of former Barcelona defender Dani Alves

results.firPara: Do you remember the dirty shirts and headbutts from previous tournaments?

Never mind the qualification victory over Germany, the test of nerve that was overcome in the play-off against Bosnia-Herzegovina or the famous win over Italy in their final group match at Euro 2016, which might just have been the Republic of Irelands finest in tournament football.
results.secPara: On Sunday afternoon, in the baking heat at the Stade de Lyon, Martin ONeills team were 1-0 up at half-time in the last-16 tie against France, the host nation and one of the favourites for the title. This is not an ordinary France team, even though their detractors point out they have yet to be tested by a high-calibre opponent.
results.webTitle: Republic of Ireland can live with the best – creating optimism for 2018 World Cup

results.firPara: In todays Fiver Gylfi Sigurdssons dreams, Leo Messis salty tears, and more
results.secPara: In todays Fiver Gylfi Sigurdssons dreams, Leo Messis salty tears, and more
results.webTitle: The Fiver | Find out once and for all whether laughter is the best medicine

results.firPara: While Argentina and Brazil have problems on and off the field, La Rojas Copa America win showed once again they are a fearless, united group of players
results.secPara: While Argentina and Brazil have problems on and off the field, La Rojas Copa America win showed once again they are a fearless, united group of players
results.webTitle: Chile's super-predators are now South America's most dangerous team

results.firPara: The 29-year-old has said he will quit the international game after another final defeat, but there is still time for a glorious ending and to emulate Diego Maradona
results.secPara: The vast majority of lives, in football and elsewhere, end in failure. The poignant farewell, the reminder of the transitory nature of the gloria mundi, are familiar parts of the narrative. But still, there would be something desperately sad, desperately unfulfilling, desperately banal, if Lionel Messis international career were to end with a penalty blazed over the bar in East Rutherford.
results.webTitle: Lionel Messi and Argentina: will his latest international low really be the end? | Jonathan Wilson

results.firPara: Got a minute? Digest the best of our Euro 2016 coverage as the last 16 concludes with a repeat of the 2012 final and England v Iceland
Paris Saint-Germain have parted company with their manager Laurent Blanc.
results.secPara: Blanc, 50, failed to guide PSG past the quarter-final of the Champions League last season and has paid the price, despite much success in Ligue 1. The former France coach won three league titles, and domestic trebles in the past two years, having been appointed three years ago.
results.webTitle: PSG part company with manager Laurent Blanc
